data.name: Simple Julian date
data.description:
In this kata you need to translate our usual representation of the date in the Julian date

You will be given the dates of this format ```(2000, 12, 30)``` and you must return it as a Julian date. This example would look like ```2458848```

Examples:
```
(2019, 01, 1)  => 2458485
(1821, 07, 17) => 2386364
(2064, 11, 23) => 2475248
(2094, 03, 19) => 2485956
(1861, 11, 14) => 2401094
(2092, 12, 2)  => 2485484
```

Notes:

  ● Suppose that time is always 12:00
  
  ● Suppose that only the correct dates are given 
  
  ● Years in the range 0 <= year <= 4000
  
  ● You can use online services to check, for example http://www.aavso.org/jd-calculator
